results.name: Number of steps required to reach the first prime when starting from n in the Collatz (or '3x+1') problem.
comment: If n=p*2^k, where k>0 and p is some prime then a(n)=k.
If n is odd then a(n)=a(3n+1)+1.
If n is even then a(n)=1 or a(n)=a(n/2)+1.
If n is composite then a(n)=A274472(n).
link: Dmitry Kamenetsky, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The Collatz iteration for 33 is 100, 50, 25, 76, 38, 19, 58, 29, ... 1. The first prime (19) is reached after 6 steps, so a(33)=6.
results.author: _Dmitry Kamenetsky_, Jan 11 2017
